pageContext.claim: “And with all of that and $35 million spent, think of that, over two years ruining lives of people, ruining their lives, people going out of business because they couldn't afford lawyers. That's just unbelievable what happened. How bad it was. I can't even tell you how bad it was. Nobody knows how people suffered.”
pageContext.analysis: Russia's meddling in the 2016 presidential election presented a serious national security issue that Congress, the intelligence community and law enforcement agencies all considered worth investigation. Mueller reported $25.2 million in direct and indirect costs through September 2018, a total that will likely increase when the final months' costs are tallied. Mueller also made money for the government, namely by seizing properties and assets from former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort that could well defease the entire cost of his investigation in the final accounting.
